randgeo
  • Reference
  • Articles
  • News

Random position

Random position

rg_position(count = 1, bbox = NULL)

Arguments

count
(integer/numeric) number of positions. Default: 1
bbox
(integer/numeric) lat/long bounding box from which to generate positions; numeric vector of the form west (long), south (lat), east (long), north (lat). optional

Value

A list, each element is a numeric vector length two of long, lat

Examples

rg_position()
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 121.12065 -12.16554
#> 
rg_position(10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 146.47661  68.15292
#>

#> 

# coerce to data.frame
stats::setNames(
  do.call("rbind.data.frame", rg_position(10)),
  c('lng', 'lat')
)
#>            lng        lat
#> 1    41.042017   6.719089
#> 2   -66.385913  52.879920
#> 3   -81.847370 -17.902539
#> 4   154.033237  71.218036
#> 5    21.416831 -45.100606
#> 6  -152.682102  36.039460
#> 7    -1.479727  28.443122
#> 8   -30.253878   6.990225
#> 9  -114.343949  57.494884
#> 10 -173.602816 -27.152470
